input: Compared to the distance between the orbits of Jupiter and Saturn, which are far away from the sun, is it more likely that the distance between the orbits of Mercury and Venus, which are closer to the sun than Jupiter and Saturn, areIn general, the farther away from the Sun, the greater the distance from one planets orbit to the next.

Mikey is studying the mesosphere. He is looking at temperatures at various altitudes within this layer of the atmosphere. If he took the temperature at 31 miles above the Earth's surface, and then again at 40 miles above the Earth's surface, the temperature would be higher at a height ofIn the mesosphere, temperature decreases as altitude increases.
You would find better air near aMore pollutants mean poorer air quality.
If Milo is flying through the air and he moves closer to the Earth, what happens to the temperature of the air?Air in the troposphere is warmer closer to Earths surface.

If Milo increases the concentration of hydrogen ions in his swimming pool, what happens to the acidity of his pool?With a higher concentration of hydrogen ions, a solution is more acidic but has a lower pH.

Ron watches a wave for 10 seconds and notices 10 crests. He watches another wave for 10 seconds and sees 5 crests. Which wave has a greater frequency?Wave frequency can be measured by counting the number of crests or compressions that pass the point in 1 second or other time period. The higher the number is, the greater is the frequency of the wave.
Water furthest away from shore will have _____ dissolved nutrients than water near shore.Therefore, water nearer shore usually contains more dissolved nutrients than water farther from shore.

Will has a pully with 5 rope segments. Alan's pully has an equal size rope with 7 segments. Which person needs less force to do the same job?The more rope segments on a pully that are helping to do the lifting work, the less force that is needed for the job.

Eric saw a fast moving particle and a slower one. The slow moving particle has _____ energy than the faster one.The particles in matter are always moving. The more energy they have, the faster they move.

Dane is dropping bouncy balls out of windows. He drops a green ball out of the first story window, then a red ball out of the second story window. The ball with the most potential energy is theSo the higher an object is above a surface, the more potential energy it has.
Ed is adding a resistor to a circuit. If he needs it to have more resistance, he should add a resistor that isLonger length resistors will offer more resistance than shorter resistors.
Jeff should add _____ to his engine to decrease the friction in its processes.To reduce friction, oil is added to the engine.
Water near shore will have _____ dissolved nutrients than water further away shore.Therefore, water nearer shore usually contains more dissolved nutrients than water farther from shore.
Ollie moved a tomato plant to an area that receives more sunlight. The tomato plant will now produce _____ food.Less photosynthesis means that plants and phytoplankton produce less food.

Scott rolls two balls together until they strike each other. When Scott rolls the balls softly, they are apart aWhen two skateboarders push against each other, it causes them to move apart. The harder they push together, the farther apart they move.

If the rate of flow in a river were reduced, what would happen to the size of sediment particles being deposited on the riverbed?The size of the eroded particles depends on the velocity of the water. Eventually, the water deposits the materials. As water slows, larger particles are deposited. As the water slows even more, smaller particles are deposited.
